author: Andrew Powell
title: 'Don't Be A Loser': NCAA Launches Hilarious Sports Betting Commercial I Can't Believe They Felt The Need To Do | The Daily Caller
text:
The NCAA is on some real clown ish for this.
The 2025 edition of March Madness began Tuesday evening with two â€œFirst Fourâ€ contests being played to determine who officially gets into the big dance. During the games, fans were treated to â€¦ if you ask me â€¦ some outright comedy.
With sports betting becoming the new norm, itâ€™s not just the teams in the NCAA tournament that will be dealing with high stakes, so will millions of Americans when they slap bets on the action. (RELATED: First Game Of March Madness Ends With Unbelievable Hail Mary Game-Winner)
With this being the case, the NCAA hilariously felt the need to launch a sports betting commercial Tuesday that basically blasts people who harass student-athletes over lost bets as blatant losers. They actually used that word, which makes this whole thing even more funny.
In fact, the advertisement is called â€œDonâ€™t Be a Loser,â€ and just â€¦ check this thing out.
WATCH:

Itâ€™s comical to me that the NCAA actually felt the need to do this, and how they did it just makes it even better. But while Iâ€™m at it, itâ€™ll prove to be completely ineffective.
As long as sports betting is involved that gives people the ability to be emotionally connected to their wallet in a sporting event, there will always be angry fans that harass players. They gotta hit those parlays!
I get what the NCAA is trying to do, but it wonâ€™t work. Thanks for the comedy, though.
